ai.summary: A challenging 16.5 km section of the Green Chain Walk in the UK, suitable for experienced hikers comfortable with long urban+parkland routes and some elevation. The route combines city streets, parks, and intermittent greenways, with several road crossings and uneven surfaces.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily urban and parkland paths with a mix of paved pavements, gravel tracks, steps, and occasional stairs. Expect variable surfaces, potential detours around construction, and road crossings. Some sections may be exposed to wind or rain.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a 16.5 km hike that passes through built-up areas and quieter parks. Carry a map or GPS and stay aware of traffic at crossings. Wear sturdy footwear and weather-appropriate clothing. Bring water, snacks, and a small first-aid kit. Check the forecast and daylight hours; tell someone your plan and estimated return time. In urban sections, watch for pedestrians, cyclists, and restricted paths.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots or trail shoes
Map, guidebook, or offline map on your phone
Headlamp or flashlight (if finishing after dark)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn, particularly May to September, when daylight and weather are more favorable for long urban-parkland hikes.

seo.title: Green Chain Walk Section 8 – 16.5 km Hard UK Hike
seo.meta_description: Explore Green Chain Walk Section 8 in the UK. A 16.5 km hard hike through urban paths and parkland with safety tips, gear suggestions, and best seasons.
